p: Relative to simple sugars, Evageliou, Richardson [ 26] showed that the sucrose concentration has a marginal effect on LGC. In the current study, sucrose is the only factor that was changed by soaking, explaining why LGC of soaked flour does not differ much from raw flour. Gelation is important in creating texture in many food products, such as yogurt, processed meats and gelatin-based products [ 65]. All BG flours would do adequately in these products due to their low LGC, with roasted BG being the poorest performer.
